intro: Cuphea froesii, commonly known as the velvetleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has ovate, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture, giving it a velvety appearance. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Cuphea froesii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant floral display and drought tolerance.
